title: Greek-English (1894) New Testament Interlinear
description:
The 1894 "Interlinear Literal Translation of The Greek New Testament" is a comprehensive work that provides a valuable tool for biblical scholars and students. Published by Arthur Hinds and Company, this edition presents a literal interlinear translation of the Greek New Testament, with the Authorized King James Version (KJV) conveniently placed in the margins for easy reference and comparison.

A key feature of this edition is the inclusion of various readings from significant textual scholars and editions of the Greek New Testament. It incorporates the textual variations from the Elzevir 1624 edition, as well as the critical works of Griesbach, Lachmann, Tischendorf, Tregelles, Alford, and Wordsworth. This breadth of sources provides a comprehensive view of the textual differences and scholarly interpretations of the New Testament.

The parallel format of the Greek text with the KJV in the margins allows readers to easily compare the original language with its English translation. This setup is particularly useful for those studying the translation process, textual criticism, and the interpretation of biblical texts. The edition is an invaluable resource for anyone looking to deepen their understanding of the New Testament in its original Greek, alongside one of the most influential English translations.
